Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: Richardson, D.C., Walsh, K.J. 2006. Binary minor planets, Annu. Rev. Earth Planet. Sci. 34, 47-81, 2006.

Data_Set_PDS3.citation_text: Richardson, D.C. and Walsh, K.J., Eds., Binary Minor Planets V1.0. EAR-A-COMPIL-5-BINMP-V1.0. NASA Planetary Data System, 2006.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: A summary of binary minor planets known or suspected as of November 2005, with properties updated as of July 2006, compiled by Rnichardson and Walsh.
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: We present a data table giving basic physical and orbital parameters for known binary minor planets in the Solar System (and Pluto/Charon) based on published literature. For the purposes of this table, a binary minor planet is any mutually orbiting pair of minor planets in our Solar System, where a minor planet is any substantial body orbiting the Sun that is not a major planet, nor is bound to a major planet.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc: Data Set Overview ================= The table lists orbital and physical properties for well-observed or suspected binary minor planets and Pluto/Charon, as inspired from Richardson & Walsh 2006 (Annu. Rev. Earth Planet. Sci. 34, 47-81). The table columns are as follows: asteroid number; asteroid name; provisional designation; asteroid type (N = near-Earth asteroid, M = Main Belt asteroid, T = Jupiter Trojan, K = trans-neptunian object); semimajor axis of system with respect to Sun (in AU); eccentricity of system; diameter of primary (km); diameter of primary uncertainty (km); spin period of primary (h); spin period uncertainty (h); semimajor axis of binary (km); semimajor axis of binary uncertainty (km); diameter of secondary (km); diameter of secondary uncertainty (km); orbital period of binary (d); orbital period of binary uncertainty (d); system mass (kg); system mass uncertainty (kg); system density (g/cc); system density uncertainty (g/cc); and reference code(s). Dashes or invalid inputs (usually -9.99) indicate unassigned or unknown values. Reference codes (usually more than one per binary) refer to entries in the ancillary document which provides full citation information. Data are ordered by asteroid number, then provisional designation.
Data_Set_PDS3.confidence_level_note: Confidence Level Overview ========================= The Astrophysics Data System (ADS) was used to collect the data presented in the table. Users are referred to the individual papers in the ancillary document for the confidence level of each item.
